children.value: This is the 23rd project of Wes Bos's
Today we'll learn how to do speech synthesis (text to speech) with JavaScript.

.embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }
See the Pen JS30-23-SpeechSynthesis-a by Deepak Karki (@deepakkarki) on CodePen.
Speech synthesis is one half of the

, the other being the speech recognition API we dealt with earlier.
Speech synthesis is accessed via the
interface, a text-to-speech component that allows programs to read out their text content (normally via the device's default speech synthesizer.) Different voice types are represented by
objects, and different parts of text that you want to be spoken are represented by
objects. You can get these spoken by passing them to the
We have handles to the various DOM elements, and we have msg - a
represents a speech request. It contains the content the speech service should read and information about how to read it (e.g. language, pitch and volume.) The
object has various properties that can be set, to manipulate the speech generated.
- Gets and sets the language of the utterance.
- Gets and sets the pitch at which the utterance will be spoken at.
- Gets and sets the speed at which the utterance will be spoken at.
- Gets and sets the text that will be synthesized when the utterance is spoken.
- Gets and sets the voice that will be used to speak the utterance.
- Gets and sets the volume that the utterance will be spoken at.
This is the most basic thing you need to do to generate speech -
// .text should be set, all other properties have defaults
// speak() does the actual synthesis - uses default voice
Now for the various features of our app!
We want the app to speak whatever text we have in the text area, so lets set the initial value of the msg text to that.
Setting the voice property - we use
event to listen to when all the voices have been loaded.

object, then filter only those which are english. Then create option tags (as strings) and add them to the

elements and the text area.
We can deal with all three inputs in one function
The name of each of the input elements match with the corresponding property name in

We have a start and stop button already, let us write a function to be triggered on click
cancels anything that is already playing, and in case
is true (viz the default case), then it replays the current text with the current settings.
is set to false in the stop button, so it doesn't start playing anything after is cancels the current speech.
to re-start the speech after a change in settings.
